title: 10 things to know before investing
summary: It’s important to not invest in the market based on emotions, such as fear or greed. Don’t buy and sell your investments too soon, you could miss out on significant gains. Check your ego at the door and understand that you’ll make mistakes along the way. Resilience is key when investing in the stock market is a risky proposition that can lead to significant gains over the long-term. It's important to have some resilience when dealing with the inevitable bumps in the road.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Unless you\u2019re a trust fund kid or a lottery winner, chances are that you don\u2019t have much cash to invest. As a recent college graduate with student loans and rent to pay, let alone the prospect of saving for retirement, you may think investing feels like an impossible task. But it doesn\u2019t have to be. You just need to know where to start.
Investing can be intimidating at first glance. Even high-net-worth individuals struggle finding trustworthy advisors who specialize in helping those with little capital get started in the market\u2014until now. The following simple strategies will help any investor begin investing with little money and see returns over time. Keep reading for more details and examples of how much you could stand to gain from investing even a small amount now and maintaining that habit for the long term.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There\u2019s a lot of mystery and fear around investing your hard-earned money. For many people, that means they never get started. But investing your money instead of just saving it can have a big impact on your financial future. In fact, time is the enemy of your money -- the sooner you begin investing for your future, the better off you\u2019ll be.
Working with as little as $10 per month or an initial investment of $100 per month, you can begin to invest for your future. While it\u2019s not necessarily easy to become a successful investor (it does take time and effort), there are simple things you can do to get started on the right foot with minimum risk. Below are 10 investing tips for beginners that will help set you on the right path toward achieving great returns on your savings:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
